TEXT.English: [H1]MEDIEVAL CONCEPTS[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]In Colonization: Medieval there are three types of Settlements you can establish. Each has it owns benefits. The first is your common village that most Citizens can found. Trading Posts and Markets can be built in your Villages. Villages can become thriving metropolises. Then there is the Monastery, which is only found by Monks or Missionarys. Monasterys are your early centers of Research and it can be critical to begin Research early. After researching Monarchy you can then found Military Outpost with your soldier units. These settlements have bonuses to Military production and you can also build the Barracks here. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Monasterys[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Monasterys begin with the Monastery building and allow the mass production of Research. They are the only settlements that can build the Library and Shrine. To found a Monastery first change a units Profession to Monk (You must have Researched Monasticism). Move the monk to a suitable site and found the Monastery.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Hostile World[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The early Dark Ages was a very hostile world. Marauders, Bandits, and wild animals roamed the country sides. Immigrants, Pilgrims, Peddlers, and Converts may have a hard time reaching your Realm if you do not keep the roads and byways safe. You should also assign Peasants to the Huntsman profession to hunt wild animals and bring in Luxury Foods (Note: Defeating Wild Animals only grants combat experence to untrained units).[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Luxury Food[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Acquiring and storing Luxury Food (You must first research Medieval Hunting) is very important to the growth of your Power and the Fealty of your subjects. When enough Luxury Food is stored a Page unit will be created. Working in your cities, Pages become Squires and Squires become Nobleman. Once you have researched Feudalism your Nobleman can become Knights, one of the most feared and respected warriors of its age.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Peddlers[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To sell your wares early on you will need to assign one of you peasants the Peddler profession. Peddlers can carry goods to and from Market and also trade with other villages. Trading with foreigners also generates some Research. (Note: Supply Wagons can not travel to Markets or trade with villages.)[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Purchacing Land[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]If the site you want to found a settlement or monastery is owned you may have to pay a fee in order to prevent hostilities from the Barbarian tribes. If a plot does have an owner its purchase cost will be displayed in the plot help text once all plots around the site have be explored.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Sheep, Horse, and Cattle[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cattle Pastures, Horse, and Sheep Pastures are unique Improvements in that they provided dual resources and slowly upgrade to Cattle and Sheep Farms. In order to build a Pasture there must be a Bonus resource present or you must have 50 Cattle or Sheep in your working town. Cattle pastures pruduce Food and Cattle. Cattle can be turned into Hides and Luxury Food. A Sheep Pasture will provide you with Wool and Sheep. Wool can be then turned into Coats by your Coat Makers.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Castles[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Defending your settlements is a high priority and to do so you will need to Research Motte and Bailey castles. Your Military units will then be able to found Military Outposts which are the center of your military production. Your workers will also be able to contruct Motte and Baily castles which start with several military buildings.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Pages[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pages are special in that they can be educated to Squires from doing any task in your settlements. They however, can not be Professions that work outside your settlements such as Workers, Peddlers, or Military professions.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Squires[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Squires work much like your Free Peasants. However, they can not become Specialist from Education but instead are Educated in your Townhalls, Manors, and Keeps or Palace. There they will learn to become Noblemen and can then aquire the Knight Profession.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Knights[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]To best defend your settlements and or conquer your enemies you will need Knights, the most powerful military profession in Medieval times. Noblemen are your primary source for Knights. In order to create Noblemen you will need Huntsmen, Bakers, and Butchers to kill or make Luxury Food. Once enough Luxury Food is stored it will be consumed to create a Page. A Page can then bet set to work in your town in any profession but none outside of town. Over time the Page will graduate to a Squire. Squires can be any profession. Squires working as Stewards (gathering Fealty) in your towns will eventually become Noblemen.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Honorary Knights[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Becoming a Knight is a costly business. The Knight's armor, equiping his War Horse, paying his assistants all require great sums of gold. Thus the rich Noblemen are usually the only ones who can afford it. However, there are times when Merchants or Specialist can be given the title of Knight through their capitol gains. Thus, any Specialist who works gathering Fealty may recieve the Knighted promotion.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Alternate Equipment[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Protecting your military units from harm is very important in building a large standing army. Through research your Craftsmen can learn to create all sorts of armor for your soldiers to wear. Military professions will also attempt to equip themselves with the best possible armor within their proffesion. For example; a Heavy Infantryman requires Scale Armor but if Mail Armor is available he will equip that instead and recieve the bonus Mail Armor has.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Armorsmiths[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Armorsmith buildings are unique in that you can select which type of Armor you want your Smiths to create. Scale Mail is the first type with Mail and Plate becomeing available through research. To change the type of Armor to make simply click on the Armorsmith building while in the city view.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Relics[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Relics are unique treasure units that must be unloaded at a Monastery. Once unloaded they will add Culture and a little gold to the coffers of the Monastery. If there is no Shrine built the Relic will produce a Shrine as well.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Shrines[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Shrines are unique buildings for Monasterys. They offer several bonuses but more importantly they attract Pilgrams from distant cities. To attract Pilgrams you simply need to establish a missionary in a foriegn town. The futher away the Pilgrams have to travel the bigger the bonus they bring.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Spice[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The lucrative Spice Trade is a very good way to increase your amount of gold at the start of the game. Initially, Spices can only be traded from Barbarian Villages, but you can discover new routes such as, the Spice Route, where you can trade Spices and other goods. One way to begin your Spice Trade it to change one of your units to the Peddler profession and move the unit to a Barbarian Village. Not all Barbarian Villages have Spice to trade.
TEXT.German: [H1]GRENZEN[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Ihre Grenzen beschränken Ihre Gebietsansprüche. Je mehr Territorium Sie beherrschen, desto mehr Ressourcen können Sie aus der Erde holen und so letztendlich mehr Gold einnehmen.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Kolonialgrenzen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die Grenzen einer Kolonie legen ihren Einfluss fest. Eine Kolonie kann nur innerhalb ihrer Grenzen Geländefelder bewirtschaften und eine Siedlung die acht Geländefelder direkt um sich herum. Außerdem können Ihre Truppen normalerweise nicht die Grenzen zu anderen Kolonien überschreiten. Wenn Sie dies tun möchten, müssen Sie entweder ein [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]Offene-Grenzen[\LINK]-Abkommen unterzeichnen oder der jeweiligen Kolonie den Krieg erklären. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Erweitern Ihrer Grenzen[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn Sie Ihre Kolonie gründen, enden Ihre Grenzen mit der ersten [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlung[\LINK]. Nach und nach erweitern sich Ihre Grenzen jedoch langsam. Dies geht etwas schneller, wenn Ihre [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlung[\LINK] mehr Freiheitsglocken generiert, doch die beste Methode, Ihre Grenzen zu erweitern, ist der Bau neuer [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlungen[\LINK]. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Grenzen der Ureinwohner[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK]-Siedlungen besitzen keine sichtbaren Grenzen, haben aber auf den Großteil der Spielwelt Einfluss. Sie können [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK]-Gebiete frei passieren und sogar [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlungen[\LINK] mitten im Gebiet der [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK] bauen, doch wenn Sie zu nahe an einer [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK]-Siedlung bauen, müssen Sie womöglich Land von ihnen erwerben oder es rauben. Die [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK] lassen Sie ihr Gebiet zwar frei passieren, erwarten dies jedoch andersherum genauso von Ihnen. Sie scheren sich nicht um Ihre Grenzen und übertreten diese auch, was aber nicht heißt, dass sie Ihnen den Krieg erklären.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Land erwerben[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn Sie eine [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Siedlung[\LINK] nahe einer [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohner[\LINK]-Siedlung bauen, müssen Sie möglicherweise mit den Ureinwohnern verhandeln, um für klare Verhältnisse zu sorgen. Sie können das Land entweder von den [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohnern[\LINK] kaufen oder es sich einfach nehmen. Wenn Sie sich dazu entschließen, das Land zu kaufen, wird Ihnen der entsprechende Betrag automatisch abgezogen. Wenn Sie das Land rauben, verschlechtert sich Ihr Verhältnis zu den [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Ureinwohnern[\LINK] mit jedem Geländefeld.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]CONFINI[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]I confini delimitano i tuoi territori: più territorio controlli, più risorse puoi ottenere dalla terra e, in definitiva, più oro guadagni.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Confini coloniali[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]I confini di una colonia ne delimitano l'influenza. Una colonia può lavorare solo le caselle all'interno dei propri confini, anche se il numero massimo di caselle che possono essere lavorate da un insediamento è rappresentato dalle otto caselle che lo circondano. Inoltre, le tue unità normalmente non possono entrare all'interno dei confini di altre colonie. Per poter superare i confini coloniali devi firmare un trattato di [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]libero passaggio[\LINK] o dichiarare guerra a un'altra colonia. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Espandere i confini[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Quando fondi una colonia, i tuoi confini sono tutto attorno all'[LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamento[\LINK]. Col tempo si espanderanno lentamente. Puoi velocizzare un po' l'espansione aumentando il numero di campane della libertà generate dal tuo [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamento[\LINK], ma il modo migliore per ingrandire i confini è costruire nuovi [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamenti[\LINK]. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Confini dei nativi[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Gli insediamenti [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] non hanno confini visibili, ma esercitano comunque un controllo su gran parte del territorio di gioco. Puoi attraversare liberamente il territorio dei [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] e puoi addirittura costruire i tuoi [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamenti[\LINK] nel cuore del territorio dei [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK], ma se costruisci troppo vicino a un insediamento [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativo[\LINK], potresti dover comperare o rubare loro della terra. Inoltre, dato che ti potrai muovere liberamente nel territorio dei [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK], sappi che anche i [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] si muoveranno con altrettanta libertà ed entreranno nel tuo territorio senza dichiarare guerra.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Acquistare territorio[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Se costruisci un [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]insediamento[\LINK] in prossimità di un insediamento [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativo[\LINK], potresti dover contrattare con i nativi per garantire il territorio del tuo insediamento. Ti verrà data la possibilità di acquistare la terra dai [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] oppure di prenderla e basta. Se decidi ci comperarla la cifra verrà direttamente tolta dal tuo tesoro. Se decidi di appropriartene, le tue relazioni con i [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativi[\LINK] peggioreranno a ogni casella che ruberai.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]FRONTERAS[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Las fronteras limitan tus derechos sobre el territorio. Cuanto más territorio tengas controlado, más serán los recursos que podrás cultivar y, a la larga, más Oro ganarás.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Fronteras coloniales[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Una frontera colonial marca el límite de la influencia de dicha colonia. Una colonia solo puede trabajar en las casillas que haya dentro de sus fronteras, aunque el número máximo de casillas que un asentamiento puede llegar a trabajar son las ocho que lo rodean directamente. Asimismo, normalmente las unidades no pueden cruzar las fronteras de otras colonias. Para ello, tienes que firmar un acuerdo de [LINK=CONCEPT_DIPLOMACY]apertura de fronteras[\LINK] o bien, declarar la guerra a aquella colonia. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Expansión de tus fronteras[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Cuando fundes la colonia, tus fronteras se limitarán al perímetro del [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamiento[\LINK]. Con el tiempo, tus fronteras se expandirán lentamente. Esta lenta expansión puede aumentarse ligeramente incrementando el número de Campanas de la libertad que genera el [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamiento[\LINK], aunque la mejor manera de hacer crecer las fronteras es levantar nuevos [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamientos[\LINK]. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Fronteras de los Nativos[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Los asentamientos [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indígenas[\LINK] no tienen fronteras visibles, aunque ejercen control sobre gran parte del territorio del juego. Puedes cruzar libremente el territorio [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]nativo[\LINK] e incluso levantar tus [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamientos[\LINK] en el corazón de éste pero, si lo haces demasiado cerca de un asentamiento [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indígena[\LINK], les tendrás que comprar el territorio recién adquirido, o bien robárselo. Así como tú puedes moverte libremente por todo el territorio [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]indígena[\LINK], ten presente que los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK] tampoco tienen mucho respeto por tus fronteras y entrarán libremente en tu territorio sin declararte la guerra.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][BOLD]Compra de territorio[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Si levantas un [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]asentamiento[\LINK] muy cerca de uno [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Indígena[\LINK], es posible que se te pida que negocies con los Nativos a fin de asegurar el territorio. Se te darán las opciones de comprar la tierra a los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK] o de ocuparla sin más. Si eliges comprar la tierra, la cantidad será sustraída automáticamente de tu tesoro. Si optas por ocupar la tierra, tus relaciones con los [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Nativos[\LINK] irán deteriorándose a medida que les quites casillas.

TEXT.English: [H1]MEDIEVAL TRADE POINTS[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]In Colonization: Medieval Players must earn Trading Points to unlock new Trade Routes, Buildings, Perks, and such. At the start of the game players can only trade with local villages but as you trade, build roads, warehouses, Trading Posts, and the like you will gain Trading Points. The amount of trading points you have is located above your gold amount. Click the Trade Sack to open the Trading Advisor. You can not select what Trade Techs to pursue but you will be able to select which Perk you want once you unlock a set of Perks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Trade Relations[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] The Civilized Leaders of the world will offer you Trade Relation Pacts. These Pacts will grant you access to their lands and also grant you Trade Points each turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Trading Post[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1] After aquireing the Trading Post perk, you can begin to establish Trading Post in Barbarian villages. You will then gain a little Trade Points each turn from these Trading Post.

TEXT.English: It is the year %s1_year. The last Roman Emperor of the Western Empire has fallen ushering in the Dark Ages, but in every age of man there arise great individuals, leaders that Divide and Conquer, Explorer, Discover, and Reinvent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have become ruler of your %s2_civ tribe. They look to you in these dark times for hope, for justice, for peace. Explore the fringes of your world and build your Empire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]To achieve victory:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Found your first Village.[PARAGRAPH:1]Begin your Conquest after attaining a 50%% Fealty to your Kingship in all your settlements.[PARAGRAPH:1]Then defend your settlements from the armies that will come against you.[PARAGRAPH:1]You must complete your Conquest before any other Nation.

Relics can be moved to your Monasteries to build Shrines which also increases Culture and provides some Gold.
TEXT.French: Relics can be moved to your Monasteries to build Shrines which also increases Culture and provides some Gold.
TEXT.German: Relics can be moved to your Monasteries to build Shrines which also increases Culture and provides some Gold.
TEXT.Italian: Relics can be moved to your Monasteries to build Shrines which also increases Culture and provides some Gold.
TEXT.Spanish: Relics can be moved to your Monasteries to build Shrines which also increases Culture and provides some Gold.

TEXT.English: Pilgrims visit shrines in your monasteries, increaseing Culture and also leaving behind a little gold. In order to attract Pilgrims to your domain, you must first Found a Monastery. Then either build a Shrine or move a Relic unit to the Monastery and use it to build a Shrine. You must also have a Mission established in a town or village on the same continent. Then Pilgrims will periodically appeaer and travel to visit your shrine.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Luxury Food[COLOR_REVERT] is produced here. Once you have researched [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Feudalism[COLOR_REVERT], with enough [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Luxury Food[COLOR_REVERT] stored you will be able to create a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Page[COLOR_REVERT]. A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Page[COLOR_REVERT] is a young Nobleman and can be trained to become a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Squire[COLOR_REVERT].
